awd_titl_txt: Deephole Three Component Seismic Observations at Cajon      Pass, California
awd_abstract_narration: This research is to emplace a 3-component seismometer at depth                 in the Cajon Pass borehole.  At the 3.5 km depth of the borehole,               this is important because this is a zone of seismogenic activity                in crystalline rock, and deep sampling of local seismic events                  increases our understanding of the components of the P- and S-                  wave seismic spectra and the seismic coda in crust undisturbed by               near surface phenomena.  If spatial and temporal statistical                    properties of earthquake occurrence, for example, b-values and                  coda Q, contain important precursory information, the largest and               cleanest seismogram sample set is available from sensors placed                 at depth.  This research is a component of the National                         Earthquake Hazard Reduction Program.
